lines.text:
[Goody, with Red along, are in a tiny ice-cream vendor's truck]
You're early. You're supposed to go down the next street first, then come up here.
Well, listen. While we're here, can I sell you anything?
No, I'm waiting for Judy Ann. They have a better flavor of pistachio.
Look, kid, go fuck a duck.
I didn't get your name.
Well, I didn't give it to ya'. My name is Lightfoot.
"Lightfoot"?
That's right.
That's a dumb name. I mean, what kind of person would name a kid that, ya' know?
What's your name?
Melody.
"Melody"? That's not a dumb name?... Hey, maybe we had the same father?
[Lightfoot is driving a truck and he sees a woman riding a motorcycle in shorts]
Hey were did you get those pants?
[the woman pulls out a hammer, pounds the truck and rides off]
You freak! I love you, come back!
Thunderbolt and Lightfoot. That sounds like something.
Hey. You stick with me kid. Your gonna live forever.

[Lightfoot shows up with the van, newly dented by the girl on the motorcycle]
Where'd you get the dents?

[Nonchalantly]
Progress. I dreamt about you last night.
What about?
I dreamt you said hello to me.
Don't you get smart with me. I'll break both your arms.
I'll keep that in mind.
Remember what I said. John and me go back a long way. But you don't mean nothin' to me, understand? Nothin'!
What'd you try and kill him for then?
Because we were friends.

[when the Thunderbolt and Lightfoot's car goes off a cliff]
What do we do now, Red?

[shouting in sign to follow them]
GERONIMO!
You ain't no country preacher, Preacher.
Go... fuck... a duck.
What's your name boy?
Lightfoot
You Indian?
Nope. Just American.

[John Doherty, aka Thunderbolt, dressed in preacher's garb, has jumped into Lightfoot's stolen Trans-Am]
I thought you were the heat.
Do I look like heat?
You look like one crazy sonofabitch for a preacher, I'll tell ya' that.
Howdy. How's business?

In this business, you're always one step away from bankruptcy. Funny money, credit, speculation... Somewhere in this country's a little ol' lady with $79.25. The five cents is a buffalo nickel... If she cashes in her investment, whole thing'll collapse. General Motors, the Pentagon, the two-party system and the whole shebang... We're all running downhill. Gotta' keep running faster or we'll fall down.
How you feelin' today, preacher?

[Reciting a line of poetry]
The clock uncoils the working day, and he wakes up feeling his youth has gone away.
Now what the hell is that? A prayer?
A poem.

[In a mocking tone]
A poem?
Poetry.
Ah. You stick with me, kid. You can live forever.

Thunderbolt and Lightfoot have accepted a ride from a crazy driver with a mess of a car]
This guy another friend of yours?
Slightly advanced, isn't he?

[Exhaust fumes start billowing up in the back seating area]
Hey, what's wrong with this wreck? We're gettin' gassed back here!
This guy's a basket case. He's got the exhaust pipe in here.
So why did you try to kill him then?
Because we were friends.
Does he know everything?
[At the same time]
No.
Yes.
You don't look so good, kid.
I believe you're right.
[a woman runs out of a motel falsely crying rape]
You really want to stay here?

[smiling]
Why not?
I don't wish to be forward but we'd like to exchange cars with you. So the faster you get out, the better it'll be for your ass.

[Eyeing the clothes in the back of the car they've just stolen]
Hey, look at this, man. It's like they got a whole department store back here. I like that.
Yeah... Those clothes and your mouth, you could be a big man.
Hey, why don't you take this watch, huh? I want you to have it.
I don't want your watch, man... I want your friendship!

[Thunderbolt and Gloria are having sex]
Take it easy, Gloria. You're killin' me.
Where'd you get all those scars from?
Marines. Korea.
Oh, yeah? I heard about that war...

[Repeated line]
Red-haired women are bad luck.

[Looking at the stolen Buick Riviera, parked in front of a truck stop diner]
You sure that's their car?
That's their hearse.
A man can do whatever he sets his mind to. Now, me, I wanna' walk in and buy a white Cadillac convertible. Actually walk in and buy it, cash.
You might set your mind to gettin' us a lift. This walkin' is tough on my bad leg.
In small-town banks, they leave the telephone off the hook in the vault at night so the local operator can listen in.
People walk into these banks with paper sacks, fill 'em with money and walk out. Anybody can do it.

Bullshit. The newest bank vaults have walls of reinforced concrete five feet thick, backed by six inches of steel. The vault door is stainless steel-faced. It's an inch and a half of cast steel, another 12 inches of burn-resisting steel, and another inch and a half of open-hearthed steel... A vault door has 20 bolts, each an inch in diameter. Eight on each side, two top and two bottom. This holds the door into a 16-inch steel jamb set in 18 inches of concrete. It's crosshatched by steel bars running both vertical and horizontal. This door is precision-made so you can't pour nitro between the door and the vault. If that isn't enough, there's microphones, electric eyes, pressure-sensitive mats, vibration detectors, tear gas, and even thermostats that detect the slightest rise in temperature. Still interested in banks?
I *knew* you weren't a preacher!

[Asking about a former heist in which Thunderbolt played a role]
Montana Armored? How did you get into the vault?
20mm cannon with armor-piercing shells. Wasn't too hard.
Thunderbolt! Thunderbolt and Lightfoot. That sounds like somethin'.
You're forgetting I'm a lot older than you.
There are plenty of guys twice my age who don't know their ass from a hole in the ground.
I won't fault you there.

[Arriving at the site of what was supposed to be the old schoolhouse, now replaced with a modern new school]
Are you sure this is the spot?
Yeah.
What? I didn't hear what you said.
I said, yeah, this is it.
Well, what happened to it?
I don't know... Progress.
What you been preachin' lately, Johnny.
Survival.

[Just been punched by Thunderbolt]
You come from hitters, don't you?
The rich get richer, the poor get poorer.
Where do you pick up these pearls of wisdom?
Books.

[Mockingly]
You mean you can actually read?
I read *you* loud and clear.
You better believe it.

[Thunderbolt is working in a metal shop]
You forgot to give me your Social Security number.
What?
I said that you forgot to give me your Social Security number.
Oh, I've forgotten it.
Forgotten it?... Ha ha!... Nobody ever forgets their number. Where you been workin'?
All maintenance personnel off the floor. Bringing in the guard dogs now.
To hell with them dogs. They treat 'em better than us. They rush us outta' here like animals.
Let's not argue now, Sam. Those dogs ate up a man here once.
Ate him?
Yeah. Wrong man came on duty, dogs ate him up. They'll go through a plate-glass window to get at ya'. A man don't fool around with those kinda' animals.
[Sound of barking dogs in background grows louder]

[Expressing reservations about his role in the upcoming heist]
Look, I don't know if I can pull this thing off. How do I know what to do?
What's the matter? The job too tough for ya'?

[Repeated line]
In for a penny, in for a pound.
Seems there was another hook-up after all.
Everything I did was for nothing?
Seems that way, doesn't it?
What happened to Goody?
I threw that little sucker out.
You prick!

[Knocks Lightfoot to the ground and kicks him savagely]
Say somethin' funny now, smart-ass!

[Final lines]
You know... you know somethin'? I don't think of us as criminals, you know? I feel we accomplished something. A good job. I feel proud of myself, man. I feel like a hero.
Are you all right, kid? You don't look too well.
I believe you're right.
[Slumps over]
Lightfoot!
[repeated line]
Shut up, Goody.
[repeated line]
What do we do now, Red?
